required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Second-line Irinotecan Combined With Cetuximab (c-CetuIRI) Versus Second-line Irinotecan Three-line Irinotecan Plus Cetuximab (s-IRI-CetuIRI) in the Treatment of Oxaliplatin and 5-FU Phase II Clinical Study of Wild-type Advanced Colorectal Cancer With RAS Gene

brief_summary.textblock: The primary endpoint is to evaluate the progression-free survival (PFS).

detailed_description.textblock: This study was designed for patients with advanced bowel cancer after first-line LOHP and 5-FU treatment failure. The control group was treated with second-line CPT-11+C225. The study group used second-line CPT-11 single drug until the third line was CPT-11+C225. treatment. Referring to the previous literature data, the PFS of the second-line treatment of CPT-11+C225 is about 4 months. This study assumes that the total PFS time of C225 can be extended to 7 months after the failure of second-line CPT-11 treatment compared with the direct second-line combination. , set α = 0.05, β = 0.2, the expected enrollment time is 2 years, the follow-up time is 1 year, the 10% sample shedding rate, the total sample size is about 60 cases per group, a total of 120 cases.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of half year

arm_group.description: single irinotecan first, then irinotecan plus cetuximab sequentially after PD
